contextId.information: God is speaking to Joseph, so these should all be singular forms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Get up, take ... flee ... Remain ... you

contextId.information: This is plural in form. John is speaking to the crowds. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The word "you" is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
These are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Jesus is talking to a group of people about what might happen to them as individuals. All occurrences of "you" and "your" are singular, but your language may require you to translate them as plurals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Jesus is talking to a group of people about what might happen to them as individuals. All occurrences of "you" and "your" are singular, but your language may require you to translate them as plurals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Jesus is talking to a group of people about what might happen to them as individuals. All instances of "you" and "your" are singular, but you may have to translate them as plurals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Jesus is talking to a group of people about what might happen to them as individuals. All occurrences of these words are singular, but you may have to translate them as plurals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to "those who were following him" in [[:en:bible:notes:mat:08:08|8:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "your" is singular. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have forgiven your sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to the Pharisees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to the twelve apostles. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
These are plural and refer to the twelve apostles. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
These are plural and refer to the twelve apostles. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is plural and refers to the twelve apostles. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
These are plural and refer to the twelve apostles. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is plural and refers to the twelve disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"We" refers to the children sitting in the marketplace. Here "you" is plural and refers to the other group of children. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: We played a flute for you

contextId.information: All occurrences of "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural. Jesus is speaking directly to the Pharisees, but he is also teaching the crowd. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
All occurrences of these words are plural and refer to the disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The word "You" is plural, referring to the disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is singular and refers to Peter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
All occurrences of this word are plural and refer to the disciples. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is singular and refers to Peter. Each man had to pay a half shekel tax. So one shekel would be enough for Jesus and Peter to pay their taxes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

All occurrences of these words are singular. Jesus is speaking to all people in general. It may be more natural for your language to translate with a plural "you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
All occurrences of these words are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
All occurrences of this word are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
All occurrences of these words are plural. Jesus is speaking to his disciples, but this parable teaches a general truth that applies to all believers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Here "you" and "your" are plural. Jesus is speaking to the Pharisees, but Moses gave this command many years earlier to their ancestors. Moses' command applied to all Jewish men in general. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your hardness ... allowed you ... your wives

contextId.information: Here "you" is plural and refers to the mother and the sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to all the people of Israel not just the religious leaders. AT: "John came to the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to the religious leaders. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural. Jesus was speaking to the religious leaders and also to the Jewish people in general. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to Jesus' followers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Jesus is speaking to Peter, but the "you" is plural referring to Peter, James, and John. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: he said to Peter, "What, could you not watch

contextId.information: Here "you" is plural and refers to the women. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
